body:
The **NoTex** editor helps you to write reports using the lightweight markup language *re-structured text* aka **RST**. Once you've written your report, it can easily be translated to various formats like **HTML**, **LaTex** and **PDF**. To launch the application, use the following link:

***
[**Launch NoTex**](http://notex.blackhan.ch/editor) will start the application. *This software is still beta!*
***

## Re-Structured Text

### Purpose
RST is commonly used for technical documentation, e.g. in documentation of software libraries. However, re-structured text is also very much suitable for other kind of texts.

### Tutorial
There are many good primers, tutorials and references about RST, e.g. [RST Primer](http://sphinx.pocoo.org/rest.html) is quite a thorough introduction and [Quick Re-Structured Text](http://docutils.sourceforge.net/docs/user/rst/quickref.html) is a good quick reference.

### Miscellanea
NoTex' front-end has entirely been written with the [ExtJS](http://www.sencha.com/products/extjs3) JavaScript and the back-end with the [http://www.djangoproject.com](Django) Python library. The back-end applies the Python document generator [Sphinx](http://sphinx.pocoo.org) to translate the RST input files to the various target formats. 

***
[**Launch NoTex**](http://notex.blackhan.ch/editor) will start the application. *This software is still beta!*
***
tagline: A web based re-structured text editor
